channel.description: Recent content in book-review on Jon Downing

item.title: Book Reviews: Non-fiction 'business'/digital/data-type books
item.description: This is a on-going list of informative ‘business’/digital/data books. If I read a book I don’t find interesting/helpful it won’t make it on to this list. Summaries are included a reminders of key points. Have read Value Proposition Design: How to Create Products and Services Customers Want (Strategyzer) Business Model Generation, Value Proposition Canvas and design. * How to join user research to products – thinking about fit (problem-solution fit, product-market fit, business model fit).

item.title: Book Review: Superintelligence by Nick Bostrom
item.description: My wife’s interest in policy and the broader societal implications of the development of Artificial Intelligence led to her ordering one of, if not the, foundational books on general AI: “Superintelligence”, by Nick Bostrom. My interest in machine learning and data science led to me to borrow said book almost from the moment it landed on our doorstep. It’s been an interesting read, and has kept me occupied on trains and in other spare moments.
